alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 8:44PM CDT until May 03 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Pembina, Walsh, Kittson and Marshall Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Pembina and Kittson Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Grand Forks, Marshall and Polk Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Clay and Cass Counties. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Grand Forks and Polk Counties. .Flooding along the Pembina River will continue. All rises and the sustained major flooding are due to snow melt in Canada entering the Pembina River. Light rain showers are possible today but shouldn`t have a direct impact on stages. No major precipitation events are expected for the next seven days. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River at Harwood. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 84.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. Actions taken to completely seal the flood barrier. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 84.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Monday evening and continue falling to 82.5 feet by next Friday. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
